Obama describes the marathon as a gathering of people "of every shape and size." But let's be honest, most of them are a pretty skinny size.
"The grace this tragedy exposed is the best of who we are," says Gov Patrick, as he introduces the President.
Not a contest, but Gov Patrick is being interrupted by applause more than anyone. "Massachusetts invented America," he says to cheers.
First laugh of the day: "And yes, we even love New York City." -Tom Menino
Mayor Tom Menino, in a wheelchair from leg surgery, struggles to stand at the lectern and deliver his opening remarks in a breaking voice.
The only event like this I've been to was after Tuscon. That one was very different from this. Defiant, almost raucous, in an enormous gym.

"Pretty shameful day for Washington," says Obama. "This is just round one."
This is not a run of the mill Obama statement. He seems furious at Washington and at Congress. Again. Guns is just the latest case study.
That phrase "vocal minority" says it all. Polls show gun rights advocates care much more about this issue than those on the other side.
No mincing words. Obama says the gun lobby & it's allies "willfully lied" about what was in the bill.
Obama refers to filibuster as "continuing distortion of senate rules." Keeps saying majority of senators voted yes, minority blocked it.
"We'll return home now, disappointed but not defeated." http://t.co/QsjsIMeDCM
